metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6054 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The rfbProcessClientNormalMessage function in libvncserver/rfbserver.c in LibVNCServer 0.9.9 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero error and server crash) via a zero value in the scaling factor in a (1) PalmVNCSetScaleFactor or (2) SetScale message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krfb - 4:4.13.3-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

libvncserver-config - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libvncserver0 - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
linuxvnc - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: italc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
krfb package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.3-0ubuntu1.1').
libvncserver package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
